summary: Project now includes an admin-facing capability to change the website logo by uploading it from within the site, with the uploaded logo stored persistently in the backend.
architectural_notes: Need backend persistent storage for uploaded logo and an admin-only UI flow to upload/update it.
known_issues: Site logo missing: Header component no longer references a logo image path, so only text renders.

existing_features.title: Add React Query hooks for reading and updating the site logo via the backend actor (query for current logo; mutation for uploading/replacing logo), and ensure cache invalidation/refetch occurs after a successful upload so the UI updates immediately.

Create an admin-only UI page accessible from the existing admin dashboard that allows an admin to upload/replace the website logo from within the site (file picker, basic client-side validation, and a preview of the currently saved logo).

Update the site Header to render the persisted logo from the backend (when available) and fall back to the existing static logo behavior when no uploaded logo exists or while loading fails; keep logo placement in the header only.

new_feature_requests.summary: Admin-only logo upload/change via website UI, stored persistently in backend (persists across redeploys)

Add backend support for storing a single site logo in canister state, including: (a) an admin-only update method to set/replace the logo (image bytes + MIME type), (b) a public query method to fetch the current logo, and (c) persistence across canister upgrades (so the logo survives redeploys/upgrades).

projectName: Admin-only website logo upload stored persistently and used in header
